item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:32, topic:535190”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=653993.msg4381270#msg4381270 date=1383622472]

Why?

Those are external libraries dude. You know, like the MySQL library? That jar is it. Or xtream, etc. It’s needed in the compile time code so the files that use them can be read without errors.

I know that, but why make it so complicated?

deps/*

And your done.

I based it off other compilers, which all had the same code. Regardless, both methods work.
[/quote]

If you’re using < Java 6 the wildcard doesn’t work.[/quote]
Then they better go update.

Can you all read the comments before posting, seriously:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:535190”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=653993.msg4380920#msg4380920 date=1383528793]
Why are you encouraging people to not use an IDE?
[/quote]
It’s not an encouragement to not use one. I use an IDE when writing code 24/7. But there are times when I have a quick fix on my server ( on the host computer which doesn’t have an IDE on it), I’ll just edit and compile on the spot. if that compiler isn’t correctly made, it won’t compile correctly.[/quote]

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:26, topic:535190”]deps/commons-io-2.4.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mee.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/xstream.jar;
Why?[/quote]
Those are external libraries dude. You know, like the MySQL library? That jar is it. Or xtream, etc. It’s needed in the compile time code so the files that use them can be read without errors.

[quote=“ohokay, post:21, topic:535190”]Another bug, it doesn’t ask to overwrite the same file, if you use the same directory
Another bug, it doesn’t replace the previous .bat file made, it adds to it.[/quote]

Yeah, that’s java’s bufferedwriter. I’ll look into adding a if X exist, delete all content and rewrite.

Edit:

Fixed the error i quoted ohokay about above.

item.title: Batch-File generator (Or as some would call, a compiler generator) - Beta releas
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“relexlawl, post:18, topic:535190”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=653993.msg4381198#msg4381198 date=1383605537]

Sorry, but that looks too so messy and also inefficient (not sure though, cba to look over that code), anyway made this a while ago, short, sweet and to the point.

[code]package org.tools;

import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.List;

public class CompilerMaker {

public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
	StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
	for (File file : listFiles("./src")) {
		if (file.isDirectory()
				&& file.listFiles().length > 0) {
			builder.append(file.getPath().substring(2) + "\\*.java ");
			System.out.println("appending new directory to builder...");
		}
	}
	System.out.println("Compiler information has been written!");
	BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./compiler.txt"));
	writer.write(builder.toString());
	writer.close();
}

public static List<File> listFiles(String directory) {
	final File folder = new File(directory);
	final List<File> files = new ArrayList<File>();
	final File[] folderArray = folder.listFiles();
	
	files.addAll(Arrays.asList(folderArray));
	for (File file : folderArray) {
		if (file.isDirectory()) {
			files.addAll(listFiles(file.getPath()));
		}
	}
	return files;
}

}[/code]

I actually ripped the code from another program I wrote, so it may not be as efficient as it should be. Also, it adds the .jars (typically from the ‘deps’ folder) into the compiler, unlike yours. I tested generated compiler and it worked like a charm, if I were to use your generator, no offense, but it’d give errors because it doesn’t have the jars being called.
[/quote]

It doesn’t add the “deps” folder, because it’s searching in the “src” folder,

for (File file : listFiles("./src")) { if (file.isDirectory() && file.listFiles().length > 0) { builder.append(file.getPath().substring(2) + "\\*.java "); System.out.println("appending new directory to builder..."); } }

In other words, you can add another loop for ./deps folder as well.[/quote]

One noticeable flaw, if there is files within the default package (i.e: src) the directory would not be added to the path.

Also Sk8 you’re the one who is misunderstanding, his does the same minus adding external assets, which is literally a line of code to add.

Read full topic

item.description:

Well this was the output for my java

@echo off
TITLE Compiler - By Sk8r
"C:\Program Files\Java\bin\javac.exe7" -classpath

Another bug, it doesn’t ask to overwrite the same file, if you use the same directory
Another bug, it doesn’t replace the previous .bat file made, it adds to it.

@echo off
TITLE Compiler - By Sk8r
"C:\Program Files\Java\bin\javac.exe7" -classpath deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/xstream.jar; -d bin ServerTDD\.settings\*.java ServerTDD\bin\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\world\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\players\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\players\skills\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\players\randomevents\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\players\packets\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\players\combat\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\players\combat\range\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\players\combat\melee\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\players\combat\magic\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\shops\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\region\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\pathfinder\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\objects\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\npcs\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\items\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\content\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\model\content\minigames\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\util\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\net\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\core\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\core\tick\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\core\task\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\core\task\impl\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\core\event\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\core\event\impl\*.java ServerTDD\bin\server\core\config\*.java ServerTDD\bin\deps\*.java ServerTDD\data\*.java ServerTDD\data\bans\*.java ServerTDD\data\cfg\*.java ServerTDD\data\characters\*.java ServerTDD\data\data\*.java ServerTDD\data\deps\*.java ServerTDD\data\logs\*.java ServerTDD\data\starters\*.java ServerTDD\src\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\core\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\core\config\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\core\event\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\core\event\impl\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\core\task\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\core\task\impl\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\core\tick\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\content\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\content\minigames\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\items\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\npcs\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\objects\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\pathfinder\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\players\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\players\combat\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\players\combat\magic\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\players\combat\melee\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\players\combat\range\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\players\packets\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\players\randomevents\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\players\skills\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\region\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\model\shops\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\net\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\util\*.java ServerTDD\src\server\world\*.java 
TITLE Finished compiling!
pause@echo off
TITLE Compiler - By Sk8r
"C:\Program Files\Java\bin\javac.exe7" -classpath deps/jython.jar;deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/xstream.jar; -d bin src\server\*.java src\server\core\*.java src\server\core\config\*.java src\server\core\event\*.java src\server\core\event\impl\*.java src\server\core\task\*.java src\server\core\task\impl\*.java src\server\core\tick\*.java src\server\model\content\*.java src\server\model\content\minigames\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\pathfinder\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\magic\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\melee\*.java src\server\model\players\combat\range\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\players\randomevents\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\region\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java

item.title: Batch-File generator (Or as some would call, a compiler generator) - Beta releas
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“relexlawl, post:18, topic:535190”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=653993.msg4381198#msg4381198 date=1383605537]

/snip

I actually ripped the code from another program I wrote, so it may not be as efficient as it should be. Also, it adds the .jars (typically from the ‘deps’ folder) into the compiler, unlike yours. I tested generated compiler and it worked like a charm, if I were to use your generator, no offense, but it’d give errors because it doesn’t have the jars being called.
[/quote]

It doesn’t add the “deps” folder, because it’s searching in the “src” folder,

for (File file : listFiles("./src")) { if (file.isDirectory() && file.listFiles().length > 0) { builder.append(file.getPath().substring(2) + "\\*.java "); System.out.println("appending new directory to builder..."); } }

In other words, you can add another loop for ./deps folder as well.[/quote]

My code does the same.
First, it builds the beginning of the batch file:

@echo off TITLE Compiler - By Sk8r "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_25\bin\javac.exe" -classpath

Then it loops through the deps and get’s all the jars (the newest one allows you to select where the deps is, or if it’s named libs, etc you can pick that):

Next, it searches all the files for the src (Source):

Finally, it makes the end of the batch:

TITLE Finished compiling! pause

If you’re wondering why I have an instance of TITLE before and after the actual code that executes the compiler, it’s because while you’re compiling, it will say the first title, but as soon as it finishes it reads the next line, which is the new title, sets the new title, and then pauses.

Basically I did it because I can hover the icon on my pc and see what the title is to know when it’s done.

[quote=“arham 4, post:19, topic:535190”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=653993.msg4381198#msg4381198 date=1383605537]if I were to use your generator, no offense, but it’d give errors because it doesn’t have the jars being called.
[/quote]

deps/*

?[/quote]

Was talking about his current, unmodified code.

Edit: updated the .jar, there was a bug if you didn’t choose a custom location, the batch file wouldn’t get made.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:535190”][quote author=relexlawl link=topic=653993.msg4381159#msg4381159 date=1383599872]
Sorry, but that looks too so messy and also inefficient (not sure though, cba to look over that code), anyway made this a while ago, short, sweet and to the point.

[code]package org.tools;

import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.List;

public class CompilerMaker {

public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
	StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
	for (File file : listFiles("./src")) {
		if (file.isDirectory()
				&& file.listFiles().length > 0) {
			builder.append(file.getPath().substring(2) + "\\*.java ");
			System.out.println("appending new directory to builder...");
		}
	}
	System.out.println("Compiler information has been written!");
	BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./compiler.txt"));
	writer.write(builder.toString());
	writer.close();
}

public static List<File> listFiles(String directory) {
	final File folder = new File(directory);
	final List<File> files = new ArrayList<File>();
	final File[] folderArray = folder.listFiles();
	
	files.addAll(Arrays.asList(folderArray));
	for (File file : folderArray) {
		if (file.isDirectory()) {
			files.addAll(listFiles(file.getPath()));
		}
	}
	return files;
}

}[/code]
[/quote]
I actually ripped the code from another program I wrote, so it may not be as efficient as it should be. Also, it adds the .jars (typically from the ‘deps’ folder) into the compiler, unlike yours. I tested generated compiler and it worked like a charm, if I were to use your generator, no offense, but it’d give errors because it doesn’t have the jars being called.[/quote]

It doesn’t add the “deps” folder, because it’s searching in the “src” folder,

for (File file : listFiles("./src")) { if (file.isDirectory() && file.listFiles().length > 0) { builder.append(file.getPath().substring(2) + "\\*.java "); System.out.println("appending new directory to builder..."); } }

In other words, you can add another loop for ./deps folder as well.

item.title: Batch-File generator (Or as some would call, a compiler generator) - Beta releas
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“relexlawl, post:16, topic:535190”]Sorry, but that looks too so messy and also inefficient (not sure though, cba to look over that code), anyway made this a while ago, short, sweet and to the point.

[code]package org.tools;

import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.List;

public class CompilerMaker {

public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
	StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
	for (File file : listFiles("./src")) {
		if (file.isDirectory()
				&& file.listFiles().length > 0) {
			builder.append(file.getPath().substring(2) + "\\*.java ");
			System.out.println("appending new directory to builder...");
		}
	}
	System.out.println("Compiler information has been written!");
	BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./compiler.txt"));
	writer.write(builder.toString());
	writer.close();
}

public static List<File> listFiles(String directory) {
	final File folder = new File(directory);
	final List<File> files = new ArrayList<File>();
	final File[] folderArray = folder.listFiles();
	
	files.addAll(Arrays.asList(folderArray));
	for (File file : folderArray) {
		if (file.isDirectory()) {
			files.addAll(listFiles(file.getPath()));
		}
	}
	return files;
}

}[/code][/quote]
I actually ripped the code from another program I wrote, so it may not be as efficient as it should be. Also, it adds the .jars (typically from the ‘deps’ folder) into the compiler, unlike yours. I tested generated compiler and it worked like a charm, if I were to use your generator, no offense, but it’d give errors because it doesn’t have the jars being called.

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:14, topic:535190”]What do you mean doesn’t work all of the time?

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2417485/file-separator-vs-slash-in-paths[/quote]

Doesn’t seem to be giving me an issue now. But for some reason before, it would literally print “File.separatorjavac.exe” and so on.

Edit: I’ve made amazing progress on the Actual GUI version. It’s nearly done.

Edit2:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:15, topic:535190”]the fake staryu is trying to beat the real staryu hmm insteresting <3

good job with this babe ;)[/quote]

You can’t remember the context of where your quote came from in the siggy of yours, can you? AtomicInt_ said that to NullAmount. I didn’t even participate in that thread all that much to give help.

item.title: Batch-File generator (Or as some would call, a compiler generator) - Beta releas
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

Sorry, but that looks too so messy and also inefficient (not sure though, cba to look over that code), anyway made this a while ago, short, sweet and to the point.

[code]package org.tools;

import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.List;

public class CompilerMaker {

public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
	StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
	for (File file : listFiles("./src")) {
		if (file.isDirectory()
				&& file.listFiles().length > 0) {
			builder.append(file.getPath().substring(2) + "\\*.java ");
			System.out.println("appending new directory to builder...");
		}
	}
	System.out.println("Compiler information has been written!");
	BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./compiler.txt"));
	writer.write(builder.toString());
	writer.close();
}

public static List<File> listFiles(String directory) {
	final File folder = new File(directory);
	final List<File> files = new ArrayList<File>();
	final File[] folderArray = folder.listFiles();
	
	files.addAll(Arrays.asList(folderArray));
	for (File file : folderArray) {
		if (file.isDirectory()) {
			files.addAll(listFiles(file.getPath()));
		}
	}
	return files;
}

}[/code]
